top_categories.workout_context: 56ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Wild Horse Gravel's High desert gravel, Canyon roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
At Wild Horse Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on high desert gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Wild Horse Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Wild Horse Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
62 miles on high desert gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Base fitness for Wild Horse Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Varied gradients on high desert gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Wild Horse Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 3,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Wild Horse Gravel’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Wild Horse Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Wild Horse Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high desert gravel to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel, canyon roads, western colorado.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 62 miles of high desert gravel in De Beque, Colorado.
